page.title: 13TRANSPORT
page.content: Along the one main road in the area, the A16 between Boston and Louth, there are buses on only two days each week, Wednesday and Saturday, and then only one each way. The houses and villages on country lanes in the area, are served by a daily post-bus. It is not used much as times are awkward and most people have their own transport. Only two households make regular use of the bus to Louth for shopping trips. There is not even an ambulance service for hospital out-patients. A volunteer car service is used instead.
